conversation.content: Hi! How are you today? I heard you wanted some advice about friendships. What’s on your mind?
Hello! I want to make new friends. How do I start?

That’s great! Start by being friendly and saying hello. Smile and ask simple questions like, “What do you like to do?” or “How’s your day going?” Listen carefully and show interest in their answers. It’s a good way to connect!
Thank you! I will try that. What if I am shy?

It’s okay to be shy! Start small—say hi to one person or join a group where you feel comfortable. Practice makes it easier. Remember, many people feel shy too, so they’ll understand. Just take it one step at a time!
That helps a lot! Should I talk about myself too?

Yes, but keep it balanced! Share a little about yourself when they ask or when it feels natural. For example, if they talk about hobbies, you can say, “I like that too!” or “I enjoy [your hobby].” It helps them get to know you better. Just remember to listen as much as you talk—it’s a two-way conversation! You’re doing great!
Thank you! I will try to share more. What if they don’t seem interested?

Don’t worry! Not everyone will click, and that’s okay. Focus on the people who respond positively and show interest in you. Making friends takes time, so be patient with yourself. Good job! You’ve completed the task. Talk to you later!
